intro: Bridelia horrida, commonly known as the rough bridelia, is a shrub native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and rough, hairy leaves. The plant is part of the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. Bridelia horrida typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
